title: Cannoli with Ricotta Cream
source: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
categories: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
ingredients: - 2 cups (240 g) all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
- 1½ tablespoons lard or unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 1 teaspoon red or white wine vinegar
- ½ to ¾ cup (60 to 90 g) powdered sugar, plus more for dusting
- Chopped pistachios, mini chocolate chips, and/or candied orange peel, for garnish
directions: 1. Drain the ricotta 1 to 2 days in advance by placing it in a sieve over a bowl in the fridge.2. To make the shells, whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa, and salt in a large bowl.3. Rub in the lard until well distributed.4. Add Marsala, vinegar, half of the beaten egg, and 1 tablespoon of water. Knead to form a stiff dough, adding the remaining water if needed.5. Wrap the dough in plastic and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.6. Cut dough into quarters. Roll each through a pasta machine on the thickest setting five times, folding each time.7. Continue rolling on progressively thinner settings until 1/16 inch (2 mm) thick.8. Cut out 3½–4 inch (9–10 cm) rounds using a cookie cutter. Re-roll scraps as needed.9. Heat 2 inches (5 cm) of vegetable oil in a heavy pot for frying.10. Wrap each dough round loosely around a cannoli mold and seal with beaten egg.11. Fry wrapped molds in batches until golden and crisp, 1 to 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels and remove molds once cool.12. Mix drained ricotta with ½ cup (60 g) powdered sugar, adding more to taste.13. Just before serving, fill shells using a piping bag or small spoon.14. Garnish with pistachios, chocolate chips, or candied orange peel.15. Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately.
